description: First collisions of 2016. Starting with 2, 8 and so on number of colliding bunches.
Collisions at 13 TeV, close to maximum number of bunches, towards the end of the intensity ramp-up. The high rate start to cause severe problems in the Pixel.
Data taking with 2028 colliding bunches, starting after the TS1 and ending when the change was made for the MET triggers.
Data taking with 2028 and 2064 colliding bunches, starting June 24 after the change in the lowest unprescaled MET trigger.
Data taking with 2064 colliding bunches, starting after the DS2 dataset on July 10.
Data taking with 2064 colliding bunches. Period starting with the permanent move to the 1.2e34 trigger menu on July 16, that menu will be used from now on.
Data taking with 2064 bunches. Period starting after MD1, on August 1.
Low-mu runs for the forward physics program.
Data taking after the end of MD2, starting on August 24.
Runs taken with beta*=2.5 km for ALFA, after TS2 in September.
Runs at high-luminosity and normal beta* after the ALFA runs and the low-mu runs for AFP.
Data taking after MD4.
VdM runs taken during 2016.
Runs taken with AFP in 2016.
One run taken with the wrong project tag.
Cosmic runs during M10, Feb 8 to Feb 14.
Runs taken during M11, Mar 7 to Mar 13.
pPb data taking at 5 TeV in 2016
pPb data taking at 8 TeV in 2016
Pbp data taking at 8 TeV in 2016, beams reversed compared to period B.
